intro: Lessingianthus fonsecae, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and sturdy, hairy stems. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for dry, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive choice for gardeners interested in drought-resistant ornamental plants.
